casebody.data:
Gilbert P. SIMONS, as Executor of the Last Will and Testament of Kate R. Simons, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. UNITED STATES of America, Defendant-Respondent. No. 82, Docket 23720. United States Court of Appeals Second Circuit. Argued Oct 6, 1955. Decided Oct. 24, 1955. Writ of Certiorari Denied Jan. 16, 1956. See 76 S.Ct 323. George Trosk, New York City (Gallop, Climenko & Gould and Lester J. Tanner, New York City, on the brief), for plaintiff-appellant. Frederic G. Rita, Atty., Dept, of Justice, Washington, D. C. (H. Brian Holland, Asst. Atty. Gen., and Ellis N. Slack and A. F. Prescott, Attys., Dept, of Justice, Washington, D. C., and Leonard P. Moore, U. S. Atty. for the Eastern Dist. of N. Y., and Elliott Kahaner, Asst. U. S. Atty., Brooklyn, N. Y., on the brief), for defendant-appellee.

Before CLARK, Chief Judge, and MEDINA and LUMBARD, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Affirmed on the opinion of District Judge Inch, 135 F.Supp. 461.
